name: Pits of Fire

pages.text: $(thing)Fire$() is an important technological advancement. In order to create fire, you will need a $(thing)Firestarter$(). In order to use, simply hold $(item)$(k:key.use)$() down on the ground. After a few moments, smoke, and then fire will be created. It may take a couple tries to light successfully.
Crafting a firestarter can be done with two sticks.

With a firestarter, it is now possible to make a $(thing)Firepit$(). In order to make one, you will need one $(thing)log$(), three $(thing)sticks$(), and optionally up to three pieces of $(thing)kindling$(). Kindling can be items such as paper, straw, or other items, and will increase the chance of successfully creating a firepit. Throw ($(item)$(k:key.drop)$()) all the items on the ground, on the same block. Then use the firestarter on the block with the items floating above it.
pages.title: Firepit

pages.text: If you were successful, a firepit will be created.

Using the firepit again will now open the firepit screen. On the left are four $(thing)fuel$() slots. Logs, Peat, and Stick Bundles can all be used as firepit fuel by placing them in the topmost slot. Fuel will be consumed from the bottommost slot. There is a gauge which displays the current $(thing)Temperature$() of the firepit, and on the right, a slot for items to be $(l:getting_started/heating)heated$() in.

Many useful items can be made in a firepit by heating them. Sticks can be heated, where they will produce two $(thing)Torches$(). Note that torches will eventually burn out, and need to be re-lit by using a $(thing)Firestarter$(), or using another $(thing)Torch$() on them.
The fire pit is also a good device for $(thing)cooking food$(). All raw meats and doughs can be cooked in a firepit, which will lengthen their shelf life. (More on that $(l:food/decay)here$())

The firepit can be extinguished at any time by using a $(thing)Shovel$() on it.$(br2)A firepit can take can also have other devices added to it to extend it's functionality. Using a $(thing)Wrought Iron Grill$() will convert the firepit into a $(l:mechanics/grill)Grill$(), and using a $(thing)Ceramic Pot$() will convert the firepit into a $(l:mechanics/pot)Pot$(). To remove either device, $(item)$(k:key.use)$() while holding $(item)$(k:key.sneak)$(). Be careful not to try to remove a hot grill or pot!
A firepit, with either a grill or pot added.
